Reviews.Title: Meet the official iPhone killer!
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I needed a lighter phone than my Google Nexus and was very close to getting an iPhone 5 due to the size and weight, but thankfully a colleague told me about the S4 mini before switching over!  This phone is absolutely awesome.  I am one of those people who HATE big screen phones, so this is a Godsend for me.  It's fast.  Perfect size.  Light.  Built extremely well for a "mini" model.  Many many features.  It's the perfect iPhone killer and has a much lower radiation output too.Its SAR rating (radiation level) is hardly 0.33 watts per kilogram of body mass (on a scale of 0 to 1.60!). Phones with such a low SAR rating are very rare, and much lower than the iPhone 5 which is a whopping 1.6 watts per kilogram!The best part, it's UNLOCKED so you can use tethering all you want with no extra charges.  Just be warned, LTE may not work on many carriers so check that ahead of time.  Mine runs on AT&T; HSPA+ and I'm happy with the speed.Don't listen to the bad reviews here.  People complaining about the Micro SIM are just delusional, any major carrier will provide a new SIM for free.  Just make sure you get a SAMSUNG SEALED PHONE or send it back!  The first one I received was not sealed and wasn't even LTE.  Amazon exchanged it for the right one.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: A liitle expensive but an Excellent Phone!!
Reviews.Author: Sophia Bahlinger
Reviews.Content: Okay. I was definitely worried about buying this phone at first because it was an international, factory unlocked phone. But, I really wanted the phone so I decided to go with it. When I got the phone, it looked awesome! The only sucky part was that the instruction manuals were all in French... But, Í can just watch reviews on YouTube about it. No problem. However, when I went to put my SIM card in, it would not fit. It was WAY too big for it because the phone takes a microSIM card. So crap. But I was so determined to use the phone I was not going to let that get me down. I contacted my local provider- I read reviews from other people on here that said to do so- but they weren't much help. This one lady was like "Oh, you just break open your SIM card and the micro one I inside of it". I was like umm okay that's not gonna happen. So, I googled it and then found this DIY on cnet that instructs you how to make a microSIM card out of your regular SIM card by cutting it. I felt really adventurous and decided to give it a try because if worse came to worse I would just have to pay $25 for a microSIM. So,I watched the video, followed the instructions, and I did it! It was not hard to do at all. Then, I took my freshly cut miroSIM card and put it in the phone. It fit perfectly. I turned the phone on and first it couldn't find my provider but then I selected a different option in the service section in setting and up popped my provider. This phone is amazing and is so fast and fun to use. Definitely worth the money. Love it!

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Until now, i have just 2 days using it, and have no complaints. The only one was that i couldn't get it on time and i had to pay another $63 to send it to my country. It took a week to get from CA to NY, which I considered was a lot of time, I had a family member in NY that had to bring it to my country, and because of that delay, my cousin left and i had to pay extra fee to send it by other carrier to my country. (I WROTE THIS REVIEW WHEN I HAD JUST 2 DAYS USING THE PHONE)AFTER 4 DAYS OF USE:When i decided to buy this phone, i checked all the reviews and the questions made to the seller and i found out, it works in my country because it match with my frequency and GHz. I bought it to use it out of USA, but I had a family that was able to bring it to my country. Due to a problem with the delivery, my cousin could not bring the phone when she returned and because of that, my aunt had to send me the phone by UPS to my country. I was avoiding paying extra fees, but at the end, I had to pay $73.30 dollars of extra fees to have it in my country. Because of that, i received the phone 28 days later than when i made the purchase.Anyway, I get the phone and i started use it and i was working very well the first 4 days, after that, the phone start to fail, the screen remained paralyzed  without making any movement, and none of the functions worked up after a while of being immobile, one of the days, the battery overheat and i had to pull out the battery fast and leave the phone off for around 12 hours.I contacted the seller telling the situation, thinking that maybe was the battery, the told me how warranty works with Samsung and the gave the steps to follow. The fact that i was out of USA, in Costa Rica, I had to contact Samsung Latin America and the will give me the places in my Country authorized to cover warranties of the Samsung items. The gave me the numbers and i went to the place hoping the will help out with the problem of the cell phone and of course using the warranty, because the phone was New, only 4 days of use. When I went to the place, they told me they were not able to help me due to 2 things: 1- The IMEI of the phone belong to Europe specific FRANCE and in my country the only cover warranties of IMEI's that belong to Latin America, that way the weren't able to cover the warranty, neither can fix the phone if I was willing to pay for it, because they can not even fix item that doesn't belong to Latin America, that way I had no choices to can fix the phone in my country.When I told the seller what happened, they never tried to help me, they just sent me an e-mail saying they will not cover the warranty and that was it. I had to speak with Amazon customer service to put a complain, and because of that, they tried to be in touch with me again (the seller), but the fact that the phone had more than 30 days since the day of the purchase, they were not able to received the phone back due to the returns policies, even when i explained that I received the phone 28 days later of the purchase and I had just 4 days using it when it started to fail.TO ALL BUYERS: PLEASE BE AWARE, when buy a phone like this one, ask the seller first the  IMEI and double check if that belong to the country you live before to make the purchase, because, i know that most of the buyers think that the sellers have to cover warranties or be responsible for defecting items, but in this case Samsung works different and warranty is based on the IMEI of the phone, and they give support and warranties only if the IMEI belongs with your country. In my case, I received a damage item and now i can't have warranty neither support..... and the seller was not what i expected.. they were not kind, neither polite, very disappointed with the seller.To all Buyers, before to make an expensive purchase, please make sure you know everything about all this issues that happened to me, that way you will not lose the money. PLEASE BE CAREFUL!

Reviews.Title: INTERNATIONAL USER BEWARE...... FRAUDULENT SELLERS
Reviews.Author: FABRIZIO MARCILLO M
Reviews.Content: If you're lucky and you get this phone, it's great. But BEWARE of fraudulent sellers (e.g. S***TY_Services_WORST_Practices)Let's face it. Someone buying am "UNLOCKED International Version No Warranty " phone, is doing it for only one reason: To use it outside the US.So a crook seller sees an oportunity to commit fraud: Let's sell them some $50 used cel phone with a sticker that says i9195 for $300 and when they noticed they where ripped off, they'll be out of the country and won't be able to complain.That was almost my story. Luckily I was able to notice ON TIME, that the model number behind the battery was for an used S7562 (a $50 cel) and not a new  i9195 (a $300 one). The worst was that this is a fraud and not an error, since the sticker outside said i9195. They know what they where doing, and they do it on purpose, to criminally cheat us. I tried to contact the seller, but they didn't want to solve the problem, they even  insulted me. Luckly, I contacted Amazon and they refunded me the money and I bought it again in another seller, and got the i9195 I wanted (which is great).  But I was almost ripped of by this "Quality_Services_Best_Practices" crooks.  Do you want to risk buying from crooks like these?Read the other reviews for this phone. And you'll se some happy people and some angry ones. This is not due to the phone itself. Some sellers are S***TY_Services_WORST_Practices and they commit fraud to people, hoping they can't complaing from abroad.The i9195 is a GREAT phone, just google i9195 review and you'll see. But you are reading this review, because you pay for the phone YOU GET, and at first I didn' get what I ordered.Be extremely aware from what seller you buy this "international" phone, because some are just waiting to rip you off

Reviews.Title: Buyers beware of speaker issues. Simple fix and it works great so far.
Reviews.Author: MadHatter
Reviews.Content: There are many good reviews and a few bad so I decided to weigh the odds and purchase. The phone was in good cosmetic condition upon arrival.Upon startup, the default language was French. This was an alarm as I had noted from another reviewer that the local Samsung repair center (Caribbean) would not service these as they are from another zone.Worse: the receiver speaker was not working! After some digging around, I realised that there was a bad connection at the speaker which would work if the speaker was pressed firmly against the case. This appeared to be an uncommon problem globally and I contemplated contacting the supplier for action but realised that cost of return within warranty period may exceed the cost of the unit since I reside in the Caribbean.I decided to forego the warranty and dismantled the phone and confirmed my speaker was faulty. I was able to pad the space between the speaker and the case and reassemble. It works fine now!This is the risk that Caribbean shoppers take when purchasing directly from the USA but it usually is still cost beneficial. Perhaps I just got a bad apple from the orchard.

Reviews.Title: Small smartphone plenty of power
Reviews.Author: Daniel González Cappa
Reviews.Content: Some few weeks ago I bought my new cell S4mini Samsung 4G/LTE model I9095 , international/unlocked version , I use it with Movistar carrier in Venezuela. Here it is my very first review after a few weeks of intense use.When I set out to buy a new phone my priorities were PORTABILITY, power / strength and reliability.The S4 -mini is a very powerful device dressed in a pocket -size) . It is a pleasant one-hand device; I mean you can use it with just one hand instead of its big brothers . It fits easily in the palm of your hand and you can run through entire screen, even in the far 4 corners- with just a simple movement of your thumb  (good point).I run my cellphone 24/7, intensive heavy -duty use and as an journalist I running permanently Internet and lot of social network. The battery lasts a few more than 24 hours of intensive (ab)use and I run it permanently connected to Internet . The battery charge is really fast with standard traveler charger supplied by Samsung ( about 45 minutes or less to full charge).Touch screen is really bright and extremely sensitive. WIFI feature is excellent ( much much better than my previous LG 4X).Even 4G/LTE service is not yet available in my country I am running 3G+ from Movistar with no problem.Its processor is fast and furious; I mean, really fast and no freezings nor hangs-outs, so far (thumbs up!). Another good one? You can go 32 Mb via microSD; so don't worry about about the storage capability for program downloads, music  or even pictures from its digital 8Mb camera.I9095 is an international version; it's means that the device comes with the European plug charger ( round pin instead of the standard American flat paddle pin -up ) . Its a problem? Solve this by  buying a traveler adapter (round-pin-to-flat pin) for some few pennies in your local convenient store, and done!A but (there's always a “but”), when you work upright (vertical position) on-screen keyboard is a little bit tricky specially if you don't have thin/tiny fingers . I guess the designers from Samsung could have improved a better digital (on-screen) keyboard design by  reducing separation between keys or even put no separation between them at all. Excelent on-screen keyboard use when you tilt the S4mini to horizontal position.My opinion about S4mini? it is an excellent choice if you are looking for portability, strenght and realibity; nice small cellphone with a heart plenty of power.And don't forget: it's a PHONE –I mean you can do calls all day long- with nice and great audio.I will keep testing my S4mini for some months more and then I will go for a second review

Reviews.Title: ADAPTER NOT INCLUDED IN PACKAGE - CARIBBEAN USER
Reviews.Author: Sincera
Reviews.Content: This review is critical review and NOT intended to degrade the sellers' reputation  in any way.The packaging was good... my package included:- 2 back covers 1. branded with the carrier's logo 2. plain white- ear phones- charger  - with NO ADAPTER- battery- phone (UNLOCKED) and is good working condition so far.- manualThe customer service was adequate. I sent two queries while my order was processing and in both instances someone responded.The response was not diplomatic & friendly as if the employee were trained in customer service BUT it was a response nonetheless.However I am absolutely PEEVED about the fact that my charger did not come with an adapter. How is this possible? This phone is supposed to be an international version i.e. it should carry an adapter, after all it is intended for international use.  Needless say, I will now be forced to purchase an adapter to ensure my phone can be charged.To follow on from this... other colleagues in my office also purchased the same exact phone but from DIFFERENT SELLERS and they did not encounter this issue.  When each phone was unboxed, every box had an adapter enclosed.SHOPEBEST, your service was not bad, the phone works well, however I would like to suggest that the international version of this phone be sourced from one of the other regions listed on the box. That means the package will come with adapter included, hopefully SHOPEBEST would not need to incur additional cost.I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: Good phone, for the right price
Reviews.Author: Russell Ericksen
Reviews.Content: When this came out, I was concerned about two things: the screen and processor. I'm not going to go through the full specs, you can find that elsewhere. But for the screen, I, like most people, was a bit disappointed that it did not have 1280x720, which would've brought it at least relatively close to the ppi of its full size brother. But I have to say, the 960x540 is really not bad at all, in fact, the 256 ppi of the S4Mini (which, by the way is nearly the same as the ipad's "retina" screen of 264 ppi) makes text decently clear. The colors really pop and the screen is very bright, I would argue as much as the full size S4.The processor (dual core instead of the full size's quad core) is pretty much the same story, for nearly all activities it is very responsive, the only times I have encountered noticeable lag is running games like temple run 2. With a standard picture wallpaper, this very rarely happened, running a complex live wallpaper and other apps made it somewhat more regular. For me this is not a deal breaker as I almost never play games, and everything else ran very smooth.Overall the phone is truly a 4 out of 5, the specs are good enough to make it very enjoyable, but some obvious and easily executable changes to the specs (those mentioned above) could have made this an excellent 5 out of 5 phone, which is sad. If you buy it at the right price (which I feel is around/at least $200 off the full size S4), you will be happy with the phone in and of itself. Though, we all compare, so if you hold it next to a full size S4, you can definitely notice the sharper text and zero lag on the S4. Unless you are always holding an S4 in your other hand, I truly think you won't feel like you are "missing out."Some of my favorite updates: I upgraded to this from the S3 mini (which I got to test out the android waters since my iPhone shattered upon first drop). Aside from the screen (which is a huge step up), most of the things I like the best are software related. I've been very impressed with the camera, especially because of the camera modes...night mode is excellent, it removes the grain from low light shots and leaves colors perfect which would otherwise be distorted with the flash. Organizing photos with folders is great. Also the new lock screen is very nice. Swiping across the clock (top portion of the screen) will bring you to the camera instantly, and/or any widgets you define, like the music player. You can also set these widgets as the default lock screen. I only wish you could have more than one lock screen widget per page.

Reviews.Title: Not enough info on phone in description.
Reviews.Author: Tiana
Reviews.Content: There is no information about the phone needing an Sims Card. Pretty upset I spent that much money and have it sent the next day and it is needing something I was unaware of. It was in perfect condition, but the box was open when I received it.

Reviews.Title: Really impressed so far and it came UNLOCKED!!
Reviews.Author: Marco Aurelio
Reviews.Content: I bought this as I had to give my wife my old iPhone 4 (she doesn't look after anything and broke her iPhone 4s).  I really wanted a new iPhone 5s but with only about 6 months away from the release of a new iPhone 6, I decided to buy something else until then.I have to say that I am really impressed with this phone, it has a nice screen, bright colours etc and feels great in the hands.  I thought that the fact it has a more of plastic build to it would put me off but on the contary, it really looks and feels great.As it only comes with 8GB as standard I bought a Kingston 32GB microSDHC card for it so now I have lots of memory for photos and apps etc.  I also bought the Tech Armor screen protector and the EasyAcc leather flip case which is really great too.I know that many people probably have the same problem as myself trying to find a reseller that actually sells what they advertise.  I do not live in the US and a family member took delivery of it whilst they were visiting friends so I was a little nervous thinking about whether it would work here or not.I am happy to confirm that this phone came UNLOCKED out of the box and I am currently using it in Venezuela on Digitel.  Even the 4G/LTE signal works perfectly.  It does say on the box that only European SIM cards are to be used but that is because this is the European model GT-I9195 and works on the same frequencies as here in Venezuela and probably the same in other Latin American countries too.  I received everything new in the box but be aware that the charger will be a European type (2 round pins), it's multi-voltage and will work with 110v but you will need to buy a seperate adaptor for it to plug into your 110v outlet.  Really no big deal at all considering everything else is perfect and as described in the listing.I hope that Amazon will not delete this part because I know that so many people always ask who the seller was.  I bought the phone from Global Mobiles and it was fulfilled by Amazon

Reviews.Title: Ask for the American products only. European are not unlocked
Reviews.Author: Claudia S Oliveira
Reviews.Content: Despite the ad say it is unlocked, there is no warning that European products are not unlocked for use in latin america. I'm returning the product. Care to buy if you're from Brazil or Latin America.

Reviews.Title: An excellent Phone
Reviews.Author: haydee peña
Reviews.Content: I live in Venezuela and here it works without problems. It has good reception and works fast. The camera is excellent. I recomend it a lot.

Reviews.Title: No concern, happier than ever.
Reviews.Author: CR4NKY4NK3R
Reviews.Content: I was quite concerned about those bad ratings from customers, but I think I nailed it with this purchase; this phone is great. I'm planning to use it in the US and LATAM. If someone wants to ask something specific about how it works in some countries, maybe I could help.I'm happy to leave a five-star rating for this seller straighttrading; not only shipped my cell phone the same day was purchased regardless that I chose free shipping, but delivered an all-round good service: good packaging, excellent quality product and they solved every question I had. Everything as advertised. In second thought, the packaging could be better, but they even sent an electric adapter for 115V-60Hz standard.

Reviews.Title: She love it!
Reviews.Author: Gio
Reviews.Content: I bought this cellphone for my sister. I think that it work for her. I didn't hear nothing bad about it, and she seems happy.

Reviews.Title: Not a quality product.
Reviews.Author: Gregory Tatro
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews but thought this time i should.  Buyer beware.  Have tried to use on 2 different cell carriers in the USA.  At first I that it was just bad signal from the provider. However after trying multiple carriers we have determined that poor signal is the fault of the device.  It will have full bars one second and the next without moving locations it will be searching for signal or indicate that it has no signal.  At times you are unable to make a call.  After reviewing the internet forums it seems that this is a common problem that occurs with this device.  Disappointing.

I don't know what to do with this phone. I am leaving on US heading to Philippines & I don't know how will I return the package.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great service after you realise it's not unlocked
Reviews.Author: Merv-Ann Thompson
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an unlocked version of this phone with a reasonable price and I found the StraightTrading company. It arrived on time, in a matter of hours actually. After receiving it, I realized that it wasn't unlocked. I emailed them, told them about the issue and that I wasn't going to pay to have it unlocked or I would return it. By the evening of that same day I got the unlock code. I think they know that the phones are not unlocked bcz other reviews say they're not but they sell them anyway. Idk how this reflects positively on themCustomer service is great. Very quick responses, and very courteous in dealing with the unlocking issue. 3 stars for the whole ordeal, other than that it would be 5PS. They'll ask you to remove your comments after you've alerted them of the problem

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Rafael Arteaga
Reviews.Content: S4 mini its a good phone, nice design, with feutures included in Galaxy S3, camera works great... Pretty much in love with my new phone...

Reviews.Title: Met and exceeded my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: I've never actually owned a smartphone until now; I was able to make do with my iPod touch and $20 Go-phone. With the iPod deteriorating in quality, I decided it was time to move on and catch up with the times. After much deliberation, I decided I'd purchase an unlocked phone to use with Straight Talk - cheapest individual plan I could find. Additionally, I decided, since I am an avid music fan, I'd need a phone with expandable memory so I wouldn't have to pay out several orifices for a large-memory iPhone. I searched, did some slight spec skimming, considered my fairly low budget, and decided to go with this phone. Some reviews made me a bit worried, namely the people who seemed like they weren't getting what they ordered...BUT my choice was fantastic. I got EXACTLY what I expected. An unlocked S4 mini, brand new. The phone itself is very attractive looking, and quite easy to figure out by yourself without sacrificing the ability to customize. The camera works fairly well. Nothing spectacular, but well enough to be used casually in most circumstances. The battery life isn't anything special either, but it's not abnormally bad - I simply use it a lot. Aside from the two aforementioned average features, there is really no other bone to pick with this product. It delivers what features I'd expect from a smartphone and all while looking pretty darn nice. Definitely glad I picked this over an iPhone - getting an equally good product from my point of view, if not better, depending on opinion, and saving a few hundred bucks at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Content: Love the phone. It works quite well. However, was not happy that the manual was in another language. Unfortunately for me, I only speak and read English.

Reviews.Title: exellent

Reviews.Content: excellent product thank you very much fulfilled expectations, I recommend it to the entire community in Latin America excellent product thank

Reviews.Title: (Just About) Everything You Need in a Small Handset
Reviews.Author: Douglas J. La Rose "Douglas"
Reviews.Content: For starters, I have owned a Samsung Galaxy S4 and also own a Samsung Galaxy Note 3.The reason I bought a S4 mini was because I am an international development worker who does a lot of agricultural fieldwork in Ethiopia and didn't want to lug around my big phablet with me in the bush. I gave my (almost brand new) Galaxy S4 to my wife and held on to my Note 3. I have basically left my Note 3 on my desk since I bought this little powerhouse. It takes great pictures and has a beautiful little screen (not as sharp as the Galaxy S4 or Note 3, but once you adapt to it you won't notice) and can run all the same apps at comparable efficiency. My co-workers who have iPhone 5Ss actually admire this little beast and constantly compliment me on it.If you're choosing between a Galaxy S4, you should probably either wait for the S5 or buy this for the meantime (or as a second phone).

Reviews.Title: S4 Mini - An excellent purchase!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely happy with my order! ^_^It arrived on time through amazon prime, and I had no issues at all. I got the right model, the battery and everything else seems to be operating well, and I'm happy with my purchase.My only issue was the charger; although it came with a changeable adapter, it doesn't quite stay on, it always pops back out. The charger is a UK charger but they included an adapter piece for those with US type of outlets, but like I said previously it doesn't quite stay on the way it should. However this is a minor issue.Coming a from a Blackberry it was a bit of a difference, but I absolutely love this device. The one thing I wish it did have though was the notification light but other than that its a truly customizable phone.I was a little worried when I read that some persons got the wrong version, but everything has been working quite well so far. So I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone, but battery life could be better
Reviews.Author: Marc Gayle
Reviews.Content: When I just got it, the battery life sucked. As in, I charged it fully right before going to bed and when I woke up the phone was completely dead. Turns out that it just has to be fully cycled (I.e. fully charged and discharged) about 3 times before it fully starts to retain charge normally.Even under normal circumstances, the charge only lasts like 3 days max and I dont use it too heavily.I am on WIFI mostly and I disabled GPS and a few other services to preserve power.This is my first Android phone, so I am not sure if this is common, but my ipod and ipad hold charge much longer - on average a week or more - with similar usage patterns.Overall though, I am coming from a blackberry curve - so this is a major step up. I am quite happy.

Reviews.Content: I really like this phone, I like the flexibility it has meaning that I don't feel locked IN in an operating system ecosystem like apple has done. I already bought it an outterbox cover and it fits it nice. It was unlocked as advertised, and I was able to connect it through MetropPCS joined with T-Mobil network LTE (U.S), they provide me a microSIM for a $10 cost NO cutting necessary. Google this model phone and look the official UK samsung website look at the "specs" to match the frequencies from the website to the intended cellular network/LTE network frequencies i.e GSM/LTE frequencies. I had it small problem with Multimedia Message Service that not even the MetroPCS Reps could help me (I just had to Factory reset the phone and got everything working) The only problem that I have with this phone is that the eye scrolling down does not seem to work, but smart stay does work when you get it perfectly aligned with good lighting.

Reviews.Title: Great phone with GREAT battery life
Reviews.Author: rpgmaker
Reviews.Content: It's a very good phone. It's pretty much the same size as the iphone 5 (I have made side by side comparisons) except a little bit larger and as powerful as android allows it to be. Due to the smaller screen size the battery life is great but this isn't apparent in the beginning, after a few charge-discharge cycles is that you begin to experience the real capacity of the battery. My use case is mostly this: BT audio during my commute to and from work (about an hour and a half total). Wifi on during the day at work. A lot of news reading and whatsapp. About two hours of gaming (mostly a game that makes intensive use of internet data, Battle Run) and you still have a lot of juice for the phone to last you the rest of the day.For custom roms users: for me the battery life is way worse with cyanogenmod. I have always used custom roms in my previous phones but mostly based on touchwiz. This phone is the first one where I have used cyanogenmod intensively and while I love all the power user options of the rom I was extremely disappointed with the battery life. I just could not make it through the day without having to recharge it at work and I HATE to charge twice a day, it also isn't very good for the battery's health over the long term. Also, the battery life indicator was incredibly unreliable once you reached under 20% levels. You could have 15% battery life (on stock the phone can make it home safely with that) left and after ten minutes the phone will be at 4% and turning off. I was left out hanging because of this more than once and when I needed the phone the most (as I was just going home from work). That was using default cyanogenmod settings of course (default scheduler and governor, no overclock or undervolted, etc) but most of the fancy stuff disabled (location, gps, data sync, nfc, etc) the same way I have it with touchwiz. In fairness some people on XDA forums seem to get good battery life out of this phone on cm but I don't know what kind of customizations they have used (most undervolt) or how they use the phone I'm just talking of my experience here. Me? I happen to like touchwiz, a lot actually, always have. I specially like how it looks (I don't know what all the hate is about). I even used a touchwiz theme on cm (it never looked quite as good as touchwiz though but that is expected). About the cm power options I miss? I can have them using the Xposed framework with the touchwiz-specific Wanam Exposed module (make sure you know what you're doing before meddling with it, but is mostly safe, needs root). I had never used the Xposed framework before and IT IS AMAZING. Glad I found it since I now have alternatives in case I don't find good custom roms (for this phone they're all mostly cyanogenmod-based). PS: I now posted this on my 9190 review also since that was my previous phone and all of this applies to that model too. I actually hoped that it would not apply to this one, since the developer in charge of cm for the S4 mini seems owns a 9195, which, I theorized, would make him pay special attention to how the rom behaved on it.

Reviews.Title: A fair price phone
Reviews.Author: Aristotele Rivas
Reviews.Content: The biggest disappointment to me is the screen. I understand that Samsung needed to reduce the size in order to shrink the phone's footprint, but it dialed the resolution back to 2011. The rest of the hardware looks good and functions well. Voice calls are generally good, signal performance was adequate, and battery life delivers a day's worth of use.The software is nearly as advanced as the full-sized phone, but nixes some of the features for reasons unknown. For example, Smart Stay and Smart Scroll are gone, but you can still use Face Unlock. The TouchWiz user interface is as flexible (and complex) as ever. The camera offers plenty of neat features, but loses the GS4's most exciting capture modes. Thank goodness the Mini takes good pictures. Media options are plentiful, even though the GS4 Mini doesn't have the best screen on which to watch movies.To wrap-up its  for what you get: a smaller, more user-friendly handset that isn't quite the flagship it pretends to be.

Reviews.Title: It's unlocked yipee!
Reviews.Author: Isilma
Reviews.Content: Congrats! this phone is a factory phone it works very well in Barbados, I was a bit concern about the reviews when I ordered it, I even contacted the sellers and they assured me that it was unlocked, sometimes you really cannot believe all of the reviews or you will end up not buying the product and now my daughter is enjoying her most precious phone, Thank you very much sellers.

Reviews.Content: The biggest disappointment to me is the screen. I understand that Samsung needed to reduce the size in order to shrink the phone's footprint, but it dialed the resolution back to 2011. The rest of the hardware looks good and functions well. Voice calls are generally good, signal performance was adequate, and battery life delivers a day's worth of use.The software is nearly as advanced as the full-sized phone, but nixes some of the features for reasons unknown. For example, Smart Stay and Smart Scroll are gone, but you can still use Face Unlock. The TouchWiz user interface is as flexible (and complex) as ever. The camera offers plenty of neat features, but loses the GS4's most exciting capture modes. Thank goodness the Mini takes good pictures. Media options are plentiful, even though the GS4 Mini doesn't have the best screen on which to watch movies.To wrap-up its  for what you get: a smaller, more user-friendly handset that isn't quite the flagship it pretends to be.

Reviews.Title: Unlocked and working well with T-mobile in the USA
Reviews.Author: tacqua "tacqua"
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of reviews saying that the phone is not unlocked but mine came unlocked and it's working well on T-mobile (3G+, no 4G) in the Philadelphia, PA area. For all those wondering, I got mine from Open Group Wireless with fulfillment by Amazon. The phone is from Orange, France, but in the initial set up I chose English as the language which made all the rest of the set up easy. I didn't have problems with the configuration with the T-mobile network. All I did was to get a micro SIM card and insert it. The phone is awesome! Great size if you are looking for a normal size phone! I am not new to Android or Samsung (my previous phone was a Samsung Ace) so working with the phone has been easy. And it's so fast that makes me wonder why I didn't change my phone before! It's fast even when I am using the 3G+. I have only two main problems with the phone that made not to rate as a 5 stars. First is that my Bluetooth is not working. I googled and I found that it seems to be an usual problem for phones with Bluetooth 4.0 and running Android 4.2.2.  Since the rumor says that this phone is getting an upgrade to the Android KitKat in June, I will keep the phone and hope the upgrade can fix it. My second issue is the battery. It's awful!! It doesn't last a full day! I have been trying to be conscious about the battery usage and turning of features I don't need, but it's still bad. Be prepared to carry a charger with you. Overall, I am happy with the purchase and experience with Amazon/Open Wireless Group and would recommend this phone. Battery seems to be an usual problem for smart phones, so we just have to learn how to deal with it.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love this phone
Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: The Galaxy S4 mini is a dream!  It has an excellent camera, great processing speed, and so many features that make things easier (like swipe texting).  It's small enough to fit in my pocket (even with a gel case on it), but it still has a large screen to enjoy.  Comparing it to my old phone would be like comparing a W8 device to a W3.1.  It's sleek and light (this phone is an inch bigger than my last one and weighs less than half).  Its battery was initially draining really fast, but that was because of a bunch of software updates. Once it completed that, the battery life went way up.  The only other thing I've noticed is that when I play games on it, it tends to get pretty warm, but that's the only time.  The speaker quality is amazing.It does come with a European plug, so be prepared to have an adapter or different plug for this phone.

Reviews.Title: Good choice!!!
Reviews.Author: dasr562
Reviews.Content: The phone came unlocked and in perfect condition.  An adapter was also provided to use with U.S. power outlets but it was not needed since I charge my phone through USB at my work computer.  I noticed that the device status indicates custom which I found out does not allow for updates if the status is custom.  I downloaded Kies (the Samsung software) and it updated the phone and the status now shows Official. The phone now updates when needed.I am using this phone on BrightSpot, the Target line through T-mobile, and so far no complaints.  It uses a micro-SIM which fortunately BrightSpot SIM cards can be used as both a regular SIM and a micro-SIM.  It comes with a SIM adapter.  The size of the phone is perfect. I fell into the trend of large phones prior this one.  Large phones are nice but not practical (for me that is).  My thumb can reach buttons and functions making it easier to type. It has the capabilities of any smartphone in a much smaller size.I recommend this phone to anyone looking for a reliable and practical device.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny.
Reviews.Author: Itsho
Reviews.Content: Amazing device.I've been using it for about three months, and I couldn't be happier.It response immediately to every click. No hangs, just pure work (and fun).It is very comfortable to hold, fits in my hand perfectly.The camera works in a click - No delay between photoshots.I would also recommend to buy a matte screen protector for sleek feeling and better experience.To summarize - run and buy it :-)

Reviews.Title: Read this...
Reviews.Author: The_ Anonymous.
Reviews.Content: This phone is truly a great phone. Yet, it lacks some of the features that it's older brother (The s4) has. Such as the notification light, and air gesture. The phone is a beautiful phone, and has a cheap sort of feel- that's only because it's backing is plastic which is better for if you drop it so that's a plus. The phone has a nano sim slot- there are different versions of the s4 mini such as the I9190 and I9192 so each sim for each phone has different requirements. The phone is pretty fast, although a few months in it freezes sometimes. Perhaps, that's due to the fact that I am constantly on it. The camera is okay, it is nothing special but the fact it has two cameras front and back (has a flash light) is great. Phone calls are clear, and the service I get is pretty good considering the phone is not from the US and hasn't even made it here yet. The fact the phone is unlocked enables you to use any service you please- not being bound to a service is nice. The price as of now is high, but not as high as an iphone, considering it is unlocked raises the price. Over all I love my phone! If you have any questions please ask!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Adriana Ghersy R.
Reviews.Content: I like it a lot. The size is perfect for me. It came with the adaptor to connect the charger.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone but its not perfect
Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: I looked into a few 'small' phones, and this was the best i found. Looks and feels like a Galaxy s4, Funny how a few years ago 4.3 inches was huge and is now considered "mini". Its about iPhone 5 sized but still has a bigger screen. Anyway I overall love this phone, the small form factor, its snappy and almost never lags, can play modern games if youre into that. Also has some of the original s4 features like smart watch and some gestures. it DOES NOT have air gesture, smart scroll, airview or S health, (which I think are kind of gimmicky anyways) also no LED notification light. I use the phone alot for work (texting and calling) and occasional candy crushing, and it limps through the day. Will not last a full 12 hour day most of the time, I guess depends on use but you will probably have to bring a charger with you. But if you can look past that this is a great little phone, I get asked about it all the time! Great ice breaker I suppose hahaPros -Small form factorNice vibrant displayOperates smoothlyCamera is great (comparable to the big S4)Cons-Battery life not so greatMissing S4 air features

Reviews.Title: Great product, and great buying experience overall
Reviews.Author: S. Hwang
Reviews.Content: I ordered mine from the seller "WorldWide Distributors" and had no problem at all. The product box was sealed, and the phone was definitely brand new. When I turned it on, the default language was French, but I was easily able to change it to English. Some reviewers said that their order came with an extra 110v-220v adapter, but mine didn't. I have a few of those lying around the house, so it wasn't a problem for me, but you should be aware that this international version likely comes from Europe and therefore the charger plug has 220v round prongs.The phone is still going strong a few months in, and I love it very much. Just be aware that you might not get the warranty service in the US. The warranty card it came with only listed European regions.

Reviews.Content: I really like my Galaxy S4 Mini I9195. I got it promptly and thought it was the perfect size for my upgrade. It was programmed in French,  but the seller provides instructions on how to change to English - not complicated.It uses a nano SIM card, so I just cut mine accordingly using a SIM template I found online and it fit perfectly fine (T-mobile user). Be careful when doing this though, you don't want to mess up your SIM. If you don't feel confident enough to do it, go to the store and get a new one.There has been an instance or two where the phone has frozen on me and turned off, but that might have been due to the excessive downloading and installing of music\apps when I first got it.  Overall I'm really happy with my purchase and would recommend this phone!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded expectations, living better dreams.
Reviews.Author: J.d. Johnson
Reviews.Content: When I was entering into the smartphone world I decided to go with Galaxy because I am an apple hater who listened to everyone who debates their phones and in most debates the Samsung Galaxy won hands down, against all competitors. I am not a big fan of the large interface screen of a regular Galaxy so I decided to go for the mini with the hope that it would fit better in my hand. (I have small hands for a man). Add the fact that at the Sprint store and with current plan it was a similar price to Apple’s year old models and I was sold.  I was not disappointed. I browse the internet in my free time,  mostly social network sites or watching videos or listening to lectures or podcasts. When I first got my phone I did not set the bar high for download speed, but very soon after purchasing the phone I found that it quickly replaced my laptop for my downtime internet browsing. It could load hundreds of pictures as fast or faster, and stream video better than any  computer I had ever owned. At least when I have an an internet connection available to access. I have found few places in Salt Lake that are not covered on the Sprint network.  Since this was my first smartphone I was a little apprehensive about learning to use the interface of a phone, I am so used to a computer that I was afraid I would miss the trackpad. I didn’t. It took me only about 5 minutes of use to fall in love with the touchscreen interface. I had no problems with worrying about what I was tapping or how it would all pop up when I called it. Every program runs smoothly when  I call it up, I have been playing a lot of sonic the hedgehog when I am waiting for my bus in the morning and I have not had a single instance of the game lagging or giving me any kind of trouble due to processor speeds. The 1.5 GB RAM is plenty for my purposes.  The Google play store is great. I quickly got a hold of all the apps I was dreaming of before I got the phone, like Pandora and Google books. As soon as the apps were installed they basically take care of themselves. I get updates for them as the updates come and they run smoothly. I use the lookout security that came with the phone and it is really good. It definitely gives me the best false sense of security that any tech security program can bring (nothing is really secure in the hands of someone who knows how to hack). It even sends candid shots of people who repeatedly fail my unlock pattern. I love it!Also standard is a bunch of Sprint money grabbing apps that are trying to be as good as Google’s. Apps like the sprintzone or internet program I quickly replaced with things like the Youtube and Chrome apps and have no intention of going back. Fortunately gmail and google calender both come standard so all I had to do was input my email and everything was synced perfectly. Even Google maps was standard and it has saved my butt once or twice in the last month.  The swipe entry method is still a work in progress. I have had the phone for about a month and still find myself regularly stopping what I was swiping so I can tap each letter to spell it out. It gets annoying when I swipe the word “what” for the 100th time today and it guesses something really different (after getting it the first 99).  The sound on the stock headphones is crystal clear for my music (classical, for study) although I will still disconnect them to answer a call because the noise cancellation technology sometimes just leaves me confused and a little disoriented as I am talking to someone.  The sound out of the back speaker is pretty good despite the lower volume, I can handle it most of the time but if I am trying to listen to some music through that over the sound of a car it lacks the power I dream of but has everything I expect considering the size of the speaker. I did get Jbl Charge bluetooth speakers and they cover all the sounds I need.  The downside to streaming music or videos is that it has a tendency to drain the battery. I can go for several hours streaming music from the internet to my speakers via the bluetooth just fine. I do also have plenty of days when I can go a day and a half without a charge because I will only use my phone for calling (I am not a terribly popular person so it doesn’t say too much).  I did get a Speck case for my phone and it has been dropped several times but has never lost an anything, not even a scratch when it was dropped onto a concrete driveway.  In summary: I like the Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini; I would recommend it to anyone who likes a phone with a simple interface that will fit in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nothing really wrong with the device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Indeed - nothing wrong with the device but I hate the fact that Amazon Prime is turning into a concealed e-Bay and this review appears to be the only way to express it.The device was brand new in a sealed box and originally meant for T-Mobile in Hungary. Instructions, default language settings and power adapter all perfect if I was in Hungary but I am not and I do not speak Hungarian either. Really not all that significant issues but I thought I could trust Amazon Prime description to be accurate and to not sell items, which really cannot be used out of the box in the country they are being sold (in this case because of the power adopter)Since it was meant for T-Mobile Hungary (no logo on the outside of the box but you can see it on the initial splash screen when powering the device up) I suspect any software updates to the device will be coming to the device if an when T-Mobile Hungary decided to push them out.  ... (Well, unless you root the device and install something else on it)Otherwise the device came unlocked but I cannot tell if it was factory unlocked or not. It could be that T-Mobile Hungary do not lock their devices at all. Either way the unit I have received appears to be working with ATT for now.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini  vs the iPhone 4S:  -  A comparison for the Business user
Reviews.Author: Mr. P. S. Rapaport
Reviews.Content: .I have just emerged from a nightmare ten days spent with this handset. It almost drove me to suicide!I should immediately declare that I am a middle-aged business phone user - i.e. I only want the mobile for calls, texts and emails plus occasional internet browsing. The Samsung Galaxy S4 Mini may be the dog's bollocks when it comes to its camera, video streaming, music and/or games (I really don't know) but I don't need any of those features on a phone. I came to the end of my 24-month network contract and was sold this handset as an upgrade from my trusty iPhone 4 which, although I know was now out of date, had nevertheless never let me down. What a mistake I made! The old adage of "if it ain't broke don't fix it" was never truer.-- COMPARISON of the key features of the SAMSUNG GALAXY S4 MINI vs the iPHONE 4S for a business user:SIZE and WEIGHT: The height/width is about the same on the two phones but not the depth. The S4 Mini, being markedly slimmer and lighter, fitted into my suit pocket more easily and didn't feel like it was bulging my jacket.✓ S4 Mini'HOME' SCREEN: The S4 Mini home screen is horrible. It includes annoying and intrusive adverts which constantly appear when you least want them and are difficult to stop. And trying to organise the screen layout is very complicated. The iPhone home screen, on the other hand, is a perfect example of the genius of Apple simplicity and 'visual logic'.✓ iPhone4SSIGNAL and CALL OUTAGES:In the few days I owned and S4 Mini I had several calls drop out and unexplained outages, even when the bars showed maximum signal. It could have been a network thing but I suspect it was the phone. The same thing had not previously happened in the same locations when I had an iPhone on the same UK network. Extremely annoying when you are on a business call.✓ iPhone4SCONTACTS: The display of contacts on the S4 Mini is irritating. Each one has a (blank) clip-art image frame for you to add your contact's mug shot, but that's irrelevant to me. Contacts are much easier to manage and less annoying to browse on the iPhone. However I did get used to the 'reverse video' (white writing on black background) on the S4 Mini. I'm not sure if I can change the settings on my new iPhone to do same but I keep meaning to try.✓ iPhone4SHANDSET LOCK: I don't know why but the screen lock on the S4 Mini kept malfunctioning, especially when the phone was in my pocket. It seemed to disengage at the slightest touch, making the notion of a 'screen lock' completely redundant.✓ iPhone4STEXTS: I found texting easy to get used to on the S4 Mini and, if anything, slightly better than on the iPhone 4. I especially liked the predictive text provided by Samsung which is better than Apple's version. However one downside is that I kept finding open (i.e. 'draft') texts in my outgoing messages list. Apparently the phone will automatically register a 'draft' if you accidentally hit the space bar - or for that matter any key - after sending a text.✓ S4 MiniBATTERY: The battery charge retention is a famous gripe of iPhone 4 users and I was assured by the store salesman that the battery on the S4 Mini was far better. In reality I found no difference at all. Both phones need charging fully every night.✓ equalEMAIL: I have multiple email accounts - business and personal - and the iPhone 4/4S is a dream from that point of view - easy to set them up and easy to manage. Not so the S4 Mini. The setup was straightforward enough but the layout and, in particular, updating of messages was a nightmare. I may possibly have been doing something wrong in the few days I had the handset (I am not a 'techy') but I hated the email experience with the S4 Mini. I felt I couldn't trust the phone and I was missing out on incoming messages. Worse still, some emails I sent were not delivered from the correct account or occasionally not sent at all. As a business user I rapidly lost confidence in the phone thereafter.✓ iPhone4SKEYPAD: I hated the screen-touch keypad on the S4 Mini. I never got used to it. Although I have quite big fingers I am a careful typist - but even so I found I had to correct up to 20% of my keystrokes on the S4 when sending emails. The keypad was erratic and unreliable, irrespective of whether the phone was turned landscape or portrait.✓ iPhone4SAPPS: One of my biggest gripes with the S4 Mini. It came complete with several (a few dozen) superfluous and useless apps which clogged up my screens and I couldn't seem to get rid of. Many of the ikons were simply horrible and in some cases too small to even decipher (although I realise you can make them bigger in 'settings'). The phone seemed to have been pre-set at the factory for a twelve year-old. Conversely I have always liked the Apple array of Apps, the layout and simplicity. Apple's design style is of course one of their biggest selling points.✓ iPhone4SBACKUP/RESTORE: One of the most important things for me - which I had taken for granted and thus hadn't fully considered before my short flirtation with the S4 Mini - is the backup facility via iTunes on my laptop and/or iCloud. I have many business contacts and always a lot of texts in my handset. It would stress me out big-time to lose them. It's so easy to sync an iPhone with iCloud/ITunes whereas when I tried to download the Samsung equivalent ('Samsung Kies') it froze my computer and, worse, came bundled with lots of horrible unwanted software and browser tools - including more bloody adverts - which I couldn't stop. It would not even uninstall via 'Add or Remove Programs'. It sent me into a mini rage and I was left feeling violated and extremely pi**ed off. That was when I decided I couldn't operate any longer with the S4 Mini'.✓ iPhone4SCALENDAR: In my line of work I constantly make appointments and over the past two years I had come to rely on my iCloud/iPhone synced calendar. I could enter a meeting into my office PC, setting an alarm/reminder, and the event would ping and remind me on my iPhone. It saved my business life many times! After owning the S4 Mini for a week I missed a meeting 'cos the phone didn't ping at me. I hated the calendar on the Samsung.✓ iPhone4SIn the light of the above which, to repeat, was my experience after only ten days' usage of the S4 Mini, I have to say that for me there is no comparison with the iPhone 4/4S. Going back to an iPhone felt like being reunited with a long-lost dearly loved relative. Maybe I would have got used to the S4 Mini in time, who knows? But the stress and frustration I would have had to go through would have most probably killed me.

Reviews.Content: Received the phone yesterday as a replacement for my bulkier Samsung Note 2. Was immediately disappointed.1) Screen colors look pale. Definitely paler than Note 2.2) When played music sound was inferior. I compared them back to back, playing exact same song, on exact same setting. Note 2 sounds noticeably better.3) Pictures taken with this camera definitely inferior to Note 2. It may also be 8 MB, but it is not the same 8 MB.4) Had weird issue with SD card. Unmounted my SanDisc 64 GB card from Note 2 and inserted into S4 Mini. No problem at first, card recognized and worked fine. After I turned off the phone and turned it on again message "SD card removed" appeared, followed by "SD card unexpectedly removed". Phone either saw the card but did not see any files on the card, or did not see the card at all. Tried to re-incert the card - worked well for a while, but once I turned off and on the phone again same thing happened. When the card was back in Note 2 it had not problem, which can only mean one thing - problem is with S4 mini.I can see here the description states that SD card up to 32 GB is OK, but the manual says that it should be able to take cards up to 64 GB. I considered buying another card, but decided not to take a chance. Given overall poor performance I have decided to return the phone and get S4. For 200 dollars extra you get the best phone on the market, superior in every aspect.The only good thing - it is, indeed, amazingly light and small. Applications run smoothly. I guess if it was the only thing that mattered I would have kept it.

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE - PROBABLY COUNTERFEIT
Reviews.Author: AJotou
Reviews.Content: Received item promptly.  Inserted battery, charged to full.  PHONE WOULD NOT TURN ON.  Unplugged charging cable, plugged in again.  BATTERY CHARGE SHOWED AS ZERO.  Charged again.  PHONE WOULD NOT TURN ON.  Only the battery icon ever showed.  Every time I unplugged the charging cable the phone did NOTHING.  Every time I plugged the cable back in the battery showed ZERO charge.  The phone would then SHOW THE BATTERY CHARGING, and eventually show the BATTERY ON FULL 100%.  STILL, THE PHONE WOULD NOT TURN ON.  Looked up how to spot a COUNTERFEIT Galaxy, and one of the items was that the letters on the backside had a clearly embossed feeling as opposed to smoothly and seamlessly printed on the back cover.  This phone had that absolutely embossed feeling on the letters.  IMMEDIATELY sent phone back to Amazon for Full Refund.  I would say Steer Clear of this merchant!!

Reviews.Title: The phone is great however, major detail was not disclosed
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived way before the eta! It looks beautiful! HOWEVER, the phone does not take a regular SIM Card. Only Micro sim card. I double checked with the manual that was provided and it said ONLY MICRO SIM CARD. I just emailed the seller to see if they have any available for regular sim. I purchased a International phone before, a Galaxy s3 mini, and my sim card fit like a glove. Hopeful that the seller replies soon!

Reviews.Title: Bad Performance
Reviews.Author: Ricardo T.
Reviews.Content: I Dont know if its becuase its unlocked or what, but the speed of the phone and the conection with the internet is much more slower than with the iphone.Very bad!! Cant work with it.
